title: WTB: Bull Durham @ non Titus inflated price
author: Joshchisox08

posts.post_title: WTB: Bull Durham @ non Titus inflated price
posts.post_content:
Titusitus appears to be ending. Now it's Durham. The guy only played in about 3 games I think.

Anyone have a Durham at a reasonable price? You know not the over inflated "Titus" price that he has been going for lately. 

Maybe I'm out of my element here but $20-$35 range

HAHA................ Name another pitcher with a 100% winning record :):)

I was incorrect Scott. He pitched 9 games and was 2-0 :p

Any of the more experienced T206 collectors have any idea why this common is so tough?  I just picked one up the other day, but it was very difficult to find one at a reasonable price.  Is someone hoarding this one like the Titus?  Is it really because he shares the name of a famous movie?

Durham has always been considered slightly tougher as far as I can recall(pre-2000). The movie helps, plus the fact it's an actual minor league team, so he's a T206 player who gets bought by non-T206 people. Good luck with getting one in that range, might want to up it a little more if you really want the card

[quote name="z28jd" post=1489231]Durham has always been considered slightly tougher as far as I can recall(pre-2000). The movie helps, plus the fact it's an actual minor league team, so he's a T206 player who gets bought by non-T206 people. Good luck with getting one in that range, might want to up it a little more if you really want the card[/QUOTE]

I'd def go higher just not sure how higher I'd go. I've missed my opportuinity a few times to get it in the price range I put down :(

The Durham has always been a premium card. The movie, the team, the tobacco all played into it.  Best player with a perfect pitching won-loss record? Easy, Jimmie Foxx.
But no Susan Sarandon, front or back, so to speak.
I actually listed one tonight in the auction section!
Did you miss the one on ebay for $39 the other day:confused:
